definition: to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to grow/to plant/to insert/to force on sb/to fall head first
stolen goods/booty/spoils
variant of 贓|赃[zang1]

sentences.english: The gun the prosecutors used must have been a plant.
sentences.chinese: 起诉方用来作证的那支枪肯定是栽赃的。

sentences.english: For years, Soviet propaganda blamed the massacre on Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，苏联的宣传机构一直栽赃纳粹德国。

sentences.english: This is no doubt meant to slander and defile money.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是对金钱的污蔑与栽赃。

sentences.english: He tried to plant the stolen money on the boy .
sentences.chinese: 他企图把偷来的钱栽赃到这个小男孩身上。

sentences.english: The thief had planned to plant the stolen watch on a fellow lodger.
sentences.chinese: 小偷打算把偷来的手表栽赃给同住的房客手上。

definition: to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to frame/to bring false charges against
to accuse falsely
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to pass the misfortune on to sb else (idiom); to blame others/to pass the buck
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to incite/to stir up/to instigate
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to slander/to smear/to vilify
to shield/to harbor/to cover up
